snippet: After election workers went home on Friday evening, Representative Charles B. Rangel still led by nearly 1,000 votes in his race against State Senator Adriano Espaillat.
abstract: Rep Charles B Rangel solidifies his claim as the nominee in his push for a 22nd term in Congress after his victory in the Democratic primary continues to be challenged by his opponent, State Senator Adriano Espaillat; New York City's Board of Elections has completed a hand count of several thousand absentee and provisional ballots, giving Rangel a lead of almost a thousand votes.

byline.original: By DAVID W. CHEN and VIVIAN YEE

lead_paragraph: After election workers went home on Friday evening, Representative Charles B. Rangel still led by nearly 1,000 votes in his race against State Senator Adriano Espaillat.

headline.seo: Rangel Confident as Lead Widens in Count of Primary Ballots
headline.main: Challenger’s Prospects Dim as Rangel’s Lead Widens in Count of Primary Ballots
headline.print_headline: Challenger’s Prospects Dim as Rangel’s Lead Widens in Count of Ballots
